text: and so the funny thing about exercise
science is it's probably one of the most
schizophrenic Sciences I think the one
thing that I probably learned more than
anything over the years especially as I
got older is roughly every 7th or 8th
week I'll take an unloading leak it
doesn't mean I take it off but I go in
and it's an easy week in the gym
personally I love lifting you know so I
usually lift four or five days a week
I'm in and out in an hour it's not like
I spend hours and hours in the gym I've
learned over the years that I don't have
to go quite as heavy as I used to you
know and my body's taking a beating from
sports and from heavy lifting but you
know you find a way to adapt to what you
really enjoy what you might be able to
do is go in and take an easy week once
in a while that's kind of more of a
maintenance or unloading week so let's
say for example take the weights I was
using the week before cut them in about
half still do the same number of sets
and reps but I'm in and out it's a light
workout it's more of just a kind of a
regeneration week mentally physically
and the next week I generally find that
I'm stronger again you know you just
give your body a chance to unload from
all that stress that you've been placing
on it and then from there you can get
right back to where you were the next
week
